com.appittome.udacity.client
Class Connection

java.lang.Object
  com.appittome.udacity.client.Connection

public abstract class Connection
extends java.lang.Object

A generic class to manage asynchronous HttpUrlConnections. Asycn connections can be generally implemented by extending the Task subclasses of this class. After a onConnectionReadyListener event Task can be executed by simply adding a onPostExecute implementation and .execute()

Nested Class Summary
 class Connection.AsyncJSONGetTask<T>
          Send a JSONObject to the server at URL+AJAX_SPEC via a GET request.
 class Connection.AsyncJSONPostTask<T>
          POST JSON to URL+AJAX_SPEC.
 class Connection.GrabPageTask
          Does a GET on whatever URL is described by URL + specs.
static interface Connection.OnConnectionReadyListener
          Implement this interface to be notified that the connection is functional.
static interface Connection.OnNewCsrfTokenListener
          Implement to listen for new CSRF_TOKENS.

url

the root URL of the server

Constructor Detail

Connection

public Connection()
Initializes the root URL to null. This object won't work until the url is defined.

Connection

public Connection(java.net.URL url)
Instantiates a working Connection object. Cookies are managed by the anrdoid OS.

Parameters:
url - the root url of the server this connection will interact with.
Method Detail

setCsrfTokenListener

public void setCsrfTokenListener(Connection.OnNewCsrfTokenListener cTokenListener)
Sets the one and only CSRF_TOKEN Listener.

Parameters:
cTokenListener - the listener to be notifed on the event..

addOnConnectionReadyListener

public boolean addOnConnectionReadyListener(Connection.OnConnectionReadyListener L)
Add another member to the list of listeners for this event.

Parameters:
L - - the listener to add
Returns:
boolean true if this set did not already contain the specified listener (@see java.util.HashSet)

notifyConnectionReadyListeners

public void notifyConnectionReadyListeners()
Notifies all listeners that this connection object has a network connection and successfully validated credentials.

checkCredentials

public void checkCredentials()
Attempts to verify both that there are credentials, and that the server accepts them (ie that this connection object already carries a valid session cookie). Note that there is no return: this is an asyc process that will notifyConnectionReadyListeners.

fetchNewCookie

public void fetchNewCookie()
Attempts to fetch a valid cookie credential from the server. The user will be prompted for credentials if none exist, and then this connection will attempt to get a vaild session cookie from the server. Note: this is an async process that will notifyConnectionReadyListeners.

loggedInto

protected boolean loggedInto(java.lang.String page)
Takes a response and determines if the credentials were successful. In the Udacity case - the credentials are posted, the page refreshed, and if the credentials worked there will be "Sign Out" found somewhere on the page. Override this to provide your own method.

Parameters:
page - the full text of a refresh response after POST of credentials JSONObject
Returns:
boolean true when the connection has successfully logged in.

parseCsrfToken

protected void parseCsrfToken(java.lang.String page)
Find the needle in a haystack. This method runs a regex ("csrf_token = \\\".{60}\\\"") over the contents of a page and pulls out what matches as the CSRF_TOKEN. onCsrfTokenListener is then notified, even if none was found (null). Override to implement your own regex / method.
